prompt: Facts: Incident occurred during the night between 25th and 26th June 1988 near Khodiar Mata Temple, Jamnagar District, Gujarat.; The deceased was Prabhudas Vaishnavi.; Accused were police officers: Anirudhsing Jadeja (Sub-Inspector), Nagdan Gadhavi (Head Constable), Naran Meraman Gadhavi (Constable), and Kandhal Sarman Jadeja (Constable).; Prosecution version: The deceased Prabhudas was apprehended by the accused police officers, taken to a secluded place near the Khodiar Mata Temple, and shot dead in a staged/fake encounter.; FIR (Exh. 35) was lodged by accused Anirudhsing himself at Jamnagar Sadar Police Station.; Anirudhsing's FIR version (Defense): While patrolling, they encountered Prabhudas (a known history-sheeter) who fired at the police party first, forcing them to fire back in self-defense, resulting in Prabhudas' death.; Post-mortem report (Dr. Trivedi, PW-1): Multiple firearm injuries found on the deceased. Injury No. 1 was sufficient in the ordinary course of nature to cause death. Blackening/tattooing indicated close-range firing for some injuries.; Ballistic Expert Report (PW-20): Confirmed weapons recovered from accused were used. Also indicated close-range firing.; Evidence included: Inquest Panchnama, Site Panchnama, Recovery Panchnamas (revolver from deceased, service revolvers/muskets from accused), witness statements (police personnel, panch witnesses), medical and forensic reports.; Trial Court (Sessions Judge, Jamnagar): Acquitted all accused, accepting the defense version of a genuine encounter and self-defense.; High Court of Gujarat: Reversed the acquittal, convicted all four accused under Section 302 read with Section 34 IPC and Section 201 read with Section 34 IPC. Sentenced them to life imprisonment for murder and 3 years RI for destroying evidence.; The accused police officers appealed the High Court's conviction to the Supreme Court. | IPC: Section 34 (Common Intention), Section 201 (Causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information to screen offender), Section 300 (Murder), Section 302 (Punishment for Murder)
